title: Wasim Akram
summary: Wasim Akram is a former Pakistani cricketer and captain of Pakistan national cricket team.

value.label: Wasim Akram was educated at Government Islamia College Civil Lines Lahore, where he played as an opening bowler and batsman.
Wasim Akram was a left-arm fast bowler who could bowl with significant pace,
Wasim Akram made his first class debut in 1984 as part of the Pakistan Automobiles Corporation team.
Akram started his ODI career against New Zealand in Pakistan in 1984 under the captaincy of Zaheer Abbas.
The New Zealand national cricket team, nicknamed the Black Caps, played their first Test in 1930 against England in Christchurch, becoming the fifth country to play Test cricket.

image.altText: Image of New Zealand national cricket team

value.label: In the 1987 Cricket World Cup held for the 1st time in South Asia, Akram struggled on Pakistani pitches.
Wasim Akram holds the record for taking the most number of ODI wickets as captain.

image.altText: Wasim Akram holds the record for taking the most number of ODI wickets as captain.

value.label: Akram took 502 ODI wickets and 414 Test wickets during his career.

image.altText: Akram took 502 ODI wickets and 414 Test wickets during his career.

value.label: Akram is the first bowler to take 500 ODI wickets.

image.altText: Akram is the first bowler to take 500 ODI wickets.

value.label: Wasim Akram's 257 not-out against Zimbabwe in 1996 is the highest innings by a number-8 batsman in Tests

image.altText: Wasim Akram's 257 not-out against Zimbabwe in 1996 is the highest innings by a number-8 batsman in Tests

value.label: Akram was the first bowler in international cricket to take more than 400 wickets in both forms of the game

image.altText: Akram was the first bowler in international cricket to take more than 400 wickets in both forms of the game

value.label: The Pakistan Men's National Cricket Team, popularly referred to as the Shaheens, Green Shirts and Men in Green, is administered by the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB). The team is a Full Member of the International Cricket Council, and participates in Test, ODI and Twenty20 International cricket matches.

image.altText: Picture of Pakistan national cricket team

value.label: Pakistan Automobiles Corporation was a first-class cricket team that played in the domestic league in Pakistan between 1983 and 1994.
